column4:
Carey Dean Moore was sentenced to death in 1980 for the murders of Reuel Van Ness Jr. and Maynard Helgeland, two cab-drivers in Omaha. Both were 47 years old. Moore was 22 at the time.
He has detailed the crimes in his prison writings. In August 1979, along with his 14-year-old younger brother, Moore approached Van Ness, who had stopped his car. He pointed a gun at the back of his head, demanding money. Van Ness reached for the gun, and Moore fired. He and his brother then drove off in the victimâ€™s car.
